evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Song of Ceremony
evidences.description1: The song about the Founder's Orb sung during the Dance of Devotion. Includes an English translation.

evidences.name: Rohl's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Time of death is around noon. His head shows signs of being hit with a blunt object.

evidences.name: Crime Photo
evidences.description1: The temple's treasure room. The body was discovered at the base of the stairs to the altar.

evidences.name: Treasure Box
evidences.description1: Forced open and its contents stolen, the average person can only see it in this newspaper article.
evidences.description2: The murder weapon. Off-limits to the public, the photo in the paper is the only one if it in existence. Its contents were stolen.
evidences.description3: The murder weapon. Not even the Magatama Key can open it. Glows in the dark.

evidences.name: Notice
evidences.description1: A notice from the day of the incident. The defendant's fingerprints were found on it.

evidences.name: Temple Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram depicting the temple treasure room area.

evidences.name: Magatama Key
evidences.description1: The sole key for opening the treasure box. Andistan'dhin keeps it on his person at all times.

evidences.name: Dance of Devotion Photo
evidences.description1: A picture of the stage. Shows Rohl on guard duty in the audience.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Rohl's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Time of death is around noon. His head shows signs of being hit with a blunt object.

evidences.name: Crime Photo
evidences.description1: The temple's treasure room. The body was discovered at the base of the stairs to the altar.

evidences.name: Treasure Box
evidences.description1: Forced open and its contents stolen, the average person can only see it in this newspaper article.

evidences.name: Song of Ceremony
evidences.description1: The song performed during the Dance of Devotion. Includes an English translation.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

evidences.name: Stage Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.

evidences.name: Crime Photo
evidences.description1: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.

evidences.name: Fingerprinting Results
evidences.description1: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top.

evidences.name: Fire Bucket
evidences.description1: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.

evidences.name: Gramarye Notebook
evidences.description1: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.

evidences.name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
evidences.description1: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.

evidences.name: Show Script
evidences.description1: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident.

evidences.name: Contract
evidences.description1: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.

evidences.name: Trucy's Statement
evidences.description1: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.

evidences.name: Sword Stand
evidences.description1: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.

evidences.name: Stage Lift #2
evidences.description1: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.

evidences.name: Show Footage
evidences.description1: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.

evidences.name: Clipboard
evidences.description1: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.

evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.

evidences.name: Prank Plan Script
evidences.description1: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.

evidences.name: Trucy's Note
evidences.description1: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Rites Guide
evidences.description1: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.

evidences.name: May 9th Newspaper
evidences.description1: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.

evidences.name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.

evidences.name: Ritual Curtain
evidences.description1: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.

evidences.name: Bloodstained Letter
evidences.description1: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.

evidences.name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
evidences.description1: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.

evidences.name: Inner Sanctum Photo
evidences.description1: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.

evidences.name: Maya's Statement
evidences.description1: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.

evidences.name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
evidences.description1: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.

evidences.name: Warbaa'd Arrow
evidences.description1: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.

evidences.name: Mountain Range Poster
evidences.description1: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.

evidences.name: Envelope
evidences.description1: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.

evidences.name: Wanted Poster
evidences.description1: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.

evidences.name: Plumed Punisher Strap
evidences.description1: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.

evidences.name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
evidences.description1: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.

evidences.name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
evidences.description1: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.

evidences.name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.

evidences.name: Warbaa'd Dagger
evidences.description1: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.

evidences.name: Brand New Flag
evidences.description1: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.

evidences.name: Nahmanda Flower
evidences.description1: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.

evidences.name: Beh'leeb's Statement
evidences.description1: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.

evidences.name: Family Photo
evidences.description1: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.

evidences.name: Tome of Secrets
evidences.description1: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Law Book
evidences.description1: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.

evidences.name: Golden Orb
evidences.description1: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.

evidences.name: Rebel Hideout Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance.
evidences.description2: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.

evidences.name: Warbaa'd Statue
evidences.description1: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My attorney's badge. It's lost that "brand-new" shine, but that just shows how far I've come.

evidences.name: Backstage Diagram
evidences.description1: Diagram of the backstage area showing the location of the stage, the dressing room, and the yard.

evidences.name: Crime Scene Report
evidences.description1: The crime scene took place in the theater dressing room. Master Toneido was found with his face thrust into a large soba bowl.
evidences.description2: Contains photos of the crime scene. The victim's dying message is clearly visible in them. Includes additional info.

evidences.name: Taifu's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The time of death is between 2 PM and 5 PM. The cause of death is suffocation.

evidences.name: Whet Soba Deed
evidences.description1: Found in the victim's possession. It's the deed to the soba shop. The deed holder is Bucky Whet.

evidences.name: Invitation
evidences.description1: The invitation Simon received from Master Toneido to the show commemorating Uendo's name succession and promotion.

evidences.name: Simon's Statement
evidences.description1: Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident.
evidences.description2: Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident. Includes additional info.

evidences.name: Karuta Cards
evidences.description1: Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They spell out "WHET NO 4."
evidences.description2: Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They originally spelt out "OWEN 4TH" as shown.

evidences.name: Taifu's Note
evidences.description1: A note thought to have been written by the victim before his death.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

evidences.name: Founder's Orb
evidences.description1: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it.
evidences.description2: Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within.
evidences.description3: The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.

evidences.name: Photo of My Father
evidences.description1: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.

evidences.name: Study Photo
evidences.description1: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee.

evidences.name: Study Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area.

evidences.name: Research Notes
evidences.description1: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.

evidences.name: Orb Transfer Agreement
evidences.description1: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."

evidences.name: Sarge's Drone
evidences.description1: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.

evidences.name: Glowing Moss
evidences.description1: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.

evidences.name: E-Mail
evidences.description1: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb.

evidences.name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
evidences.description1: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.

evidences.name: Raincoat
evidences.description1: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.

evidences.name: Robbery Report
evidences.description1: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.

evidences.name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.

evidences.name: Armie's Statement
evidences.description1: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.

evidences.name: Inga's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.

evidences.name: Tomb Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.

evidences.name: Tomb Crime Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.

evidences.name: Gemstone
evidences.description1: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.

evidences.name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
evidences.description1: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood.
evidences.description2: A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.

evidences.name: Mysterious Bloodstain
evidences.description1: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.

evidences.name: Painkiller Shots
evidences.description1: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.

evidences.name: Inga's Notepad
evidences.description1: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.

evidences.name: Woman's Photo
evidences.description1: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago.

evidences.name: Channeling Photo
evidences.description1: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.

evidences.name: Ahlbi's Statement
evidences.description1: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, and stole Nayna's hat.

evidences.name: Amara's Assassination File
evidences.description1: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Law Book
evidences.description1: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Badge
evidences.description1: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
evidences.description1: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Ellen's Pendant
evidences.description1: A pendant worn by Ellen. It seems she received it from her fiancé.

evidences.name: Ellen's Statement
evidences.description1: Ellen saw a suspicious third party on the vista deck when she was being attacked by Gloomsbury.

evidences.name: Flying Chapel Pamphlet
evidences.description1: A pamphlet for the Flying Chapel. It includes a brief introduction and diagrams of its layout.

evidences.name: Time Keeper
evidences.description1: The murder weapon. Dubbed the "Time Keeper," it's a clock with a secret mechanism.
evidences.description2: The activated Time Keeper. It's obvious that it was in this state when it was used on the victim.

evidences.name: Broken Lantern
evidences.description1: The Pegabull lantern in which the victim's body was found.
evidences.description2: The lantern in which the victim's body was found. Larry wheeled it from the hold to the reception hall before the reception began.
evidences.description3: The lantern in which the victim's body was found. Ema restored it, but something about it still seems off.
evidences.description4: The restored lantern. There's a bloodstain on the inside wheel handle, as if somebody gripped it with a bloody hand.

evidences.name: Photo of Victim
evidences.description1: The victim was discovered inside of the lanterns in the reception hall.

evidences.name: Gloomsbury's Note
evidences.description1: A note found near the victim's body. The writing is smudged as through written by a right-handed person.

evidences.name: Fog Machine
evidences.description1: A device that utilizes dry ice to emit a large amount of thick, fog-like vapor.

evidences.name: Business Card Wallet
evidences.description1: A business card holder with a peculiar yet suspiciously familiar imprint in the center.

evidences.name: Photo of Reception
evidences.description1: A photo of the reception taken by a relative. Much of the reception hall is obscured by thick fog.

evidences.name: Selena Sprocket Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of Sorin's older sister, Selena. It looks like it was taken in some kind of office.

evidences.name: Larry's Drawing
evidences.description1: A drawing Larry made from inside a cabin. It shows a pterodactyl flying outside the window.
evidences.description2: A drawing Larry made. He probably mistook something for what he claims is a pterodactyl in this picture.

evidences.name: Photo of Hold
evidences.description1: A photo of the hold, stealthily taken by Larry. Ellen can be seen near the center.

evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Gloomsbury's head shows signs of being hit twice. The Time Keeper was used as the murder weapon.

evidences.name: Hold Entry Record
evidences.description1: A record of the key cards used to access the airship hold.

evidences.name: Lift Bloodstain
evidences.description1: A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift in the hold. It's unknown whose blood it is.
evidences.description2: A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift. It matches the blood on the candelabra.

evidences.name: Candelabra
evidences.description1: A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's left hand, which is his dominant hand.
evidences.description2: A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's dominant left hand. Traces of blood were found on it.
evidences.description3: A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's dominant left hand. Stained with the same blood found on the lift.

evidences.name: Sorin's Notebook
evidences.description1: A database-like notebook that chronicles the events of each day in minute detail.
evidences.description2: A notebook that records Sorin's memories in minute detail. One of the pages has been torn out.

evidences.name: Newspaper Article
evidences.description1: A clipping of a newspaper article detailing the car accident that resulted in Selena Sprocket's death.
evidences.description2: A clipping of a newspaper article about Selena Sprocket's car accident. Sorin was the one driving.

evidences.name: Key of Love
evidences.description1: A heart-shaped key used to activate the Time Keeper.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Article on Channeling
evidences.description1: A newspaper article about spirit channeling, It features an interview with a bona fide spirit medium, Pearls.

evidences.name: Scroll
evidences.description1: A tourism scroll for the Kingdom of Khura'in. It includes a special feature on the crown princess, Rayfa.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

evidences.name: Nine-Tails Vale Guidebook
evidences.description1: A guidebook for Nine-Tails Vale, a village known for its Japanese ambience and its legends of creatures like the Nine-Tailed Fox.

evidences.name: Penrose Theater Flyer
evidences.description1: Witness wicked magical acts performed by our flashy miracle-working magicians, this week at the Penrose Theater!

evidences.name: Space Center Pamphlet
evidences.description1: A pamphlet for the Cosmos Space Center, a place teeming with knowledge on the wonders of the universe.

evidences.name: Lotus Root
evidences.description1: A Nine-Tails Vale local specialty. A stunningly delicious vegetable used as a topping at the Cat's Tail Noodles stand.

evidences.name: Warding Charm
evidences.description1: A warding charm received from Jinxie. These charms are the village's best-selling souvenirs.

evidences.name: Legend of Kyubi Scroll
evidences.description1: A scroll illustrating the Nine-Tailed Fox and a seemingly endless parade of horrifying creatures.

evidences.name: Steel Samurai Poster
evidences.description1: A poster featuring the protector of Neo Olde Tokyo, the Steel Samurai. Mr. Edgeworth dropped it in front of the theater,

evidences.name: Promo Video
evidences.description1: A promotional video featuring Trucy's magic show that starts tomorrow. Trucy was nice enough to give us a copy.

evidences.name: The Amazing Mr. Hat
evidences.description1: Trucy's signature trick. It seems he's going to play a big part in tomorrow's show, as well.
